pageContent.title: Not Quite
pageContent.descriptionText:
Not Quite“This is a Results question, not an Execute Next Steps question. Asking this now will likely send Dr. Cardonza in a different direction and risk making any progress with this conversation.

The best question to ask at this point is, “What factors or criteria are most important to you when you consider trialing a product you have never used before?”

This Execute Next Steps question moves you toward taking action and helps you to better understand what he values when making prescribing decisions.

Here is how Dr. Cardonza would have answered that question:

“I must be comfortable with a drug’s efficacy and safety profile. Those are the givens. After that, it should have good insurance coverage, be available at a reasonable cost, and shouldn’t be a hassle for my department to prescribe. I won’t begin a new product just to have a new product.””
